Output fields are specific to the asset type selected. For example, the output for a server configuration item includes a list of attributes about the server, such as host name, operating system, and number of network cards.

appstream2.description: Stream Desktop Applications Securely to a Browser

DescribeDirectoryConfigs.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes one or more specified Directory Config objects for AppStream 2.0, if the names for these objects are provided. Otherwise, all Directory Config objects in the account are described. This object includes the information required to join streaming instances to an Active Directory domain.

DescribeImageBuilders.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes one or more specified image builders, if the image builder names are provided. Otherwise, all image builders in the account are described.

DescribeImagePermissions.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes the permissions for shared AWS account IDs on a private image that you own.

DescribeImages.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes one or more specified images, if the image names are provided. Otherwise, all images in the account are described.

DescribeSessions.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes the streaming sessions for the specified stack and fleet. If a user ID is provided for the stack and fleet, only the streaming sessions for that user are described.

DescribeStacks.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes one or more specified stacks, if the stack names are provided. Otherwise, all stacks in the account are described.

DescribeUserStackAssociations.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes the UserStackAssociation objects.

DescribeUsers.description: Grants permission to retrieve a list that describes users in the user pool.

CreateDirectoryConfig.description: Grants permission to create a Directory Config object in AppStream 2.0. This object includes the information required to join streaming instances to an Active Directory domain.

CreateFleet.description: Grants permission to create a fleet. A fleet consists of streaming instances that run a specified image.

CreateStack.description: Grants permission to create a stack to start streaming applications to users. A stack consists of an associated fleet, user access policies, and storage configurations.

CreateUser.description: Grants permission to create a new user in the user pool.

DeleteFleet.description: Grants permission to delete the specified fleet.

DeleteImagePermissions.description: Grants permission to delete permissions for the specified private image.

DeleteStack.description: Grants permission to delete the specified stack. After the stack is deleted, the application streaming environment provided by the stack is no longer available to users. Also, any reservations made for application streaming sessions for the stack are released.

DeleteUser.description: Grants permission to delete a user from the user pool.

DisableUser.description: Grants permission to disable the specified user in the user pool.

DisassociateFleet.description: Grants permission to disassociate the specified fleet from the specified stack.

StartFleet.description: Grants permission to start the specified fleet.

StartImageBuilder.description: Grants permission to start the specified image builder.

StopFleet.description: Grants permission to stop the specified fleet.

StopImageBuilder.description: Grants permission to stop the specified image builder.

UpdateFleet.description: Grants permission to update the specified fleet. All attributes except the fleet name can be updated when the fleet is in the STOPPED state.

UpdateStack.description: Grants permission to update the specified fields for the specified stack.

ec2autoscaling.description: Scale Compute Capacity to Meet Demand

DescribeAccountLimits.description: Describes the current Auto Scaling resource limits for your AWS account.

DescribeAdjustmentTypes.description: Describes the policy adjustment types for use with PutScalingPolicy.

DescribeAutoScalingGroups.description: Describes one or more Auto Scaling groups. If a list of names is not provided, the call describes all Auto Scaling groups.

UpdateAutoScalingGroup.description: Updates the configuration for the specified Auto Scaling group.

efs.description: Fully managed file system for EC2

ModifyMountTargetSecurityGroups.description: Modifies the set of security groups in effect for a mount target.

DescribeCacheClusters.description: The DescribeCacheClusters action returns information about all provisioned cache clusters if no cache cluster identifier is specified, or about a specific cache cluster if a cache cluster identifier is supplied.

DescribeCacheEngineVersions.description: The DescribeCacheEngineVersions action returns a list of the available cache engines and their versions.

DescribeReplicationGroups.description: The DescribeReplicationGroups action returns information about a particular replication group.

CopySnapshot.description: The CopySnapshot action makes a copy of an existing snapshot.

StartMonitoringMembers.description: Re-enables GuardDuty to monitor findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. A master GuardDuty account can run this command after disabling GuardDuty from monitoring these members\' findings by running StopMonitoringMembers.

StopMonitoringMembers.description: Disables GuardDuty from monitoring findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. After running this command, a master GuardDuty account can run StartMonitoringMembers to re-enable GuardDuty to monitor these members\' findings.

ListShards.description: Lists the shards in a stream and provides information about each shard.

DescribeLimits.description: Describes the shard limits and usage for the account.

DescribeStreamSummary.description: Provides a summarized description of the specified Kinesis data stream without the shard list.

GetRecords.description: Gets data records from a shard.

GetShardIterator.description: Gets a shard iterator. A shard iterator expires five minutes after it is returned to the requester.

ListTagsForStream.description: Lists the tags for the specified Amazon Kinesis stream.

SubscribeToShard.description: Listening to a specific shard with enhanced fan-out.

AddTagsToStream.description: Adds or updates tags for the specified Amazon Kinesis stream. Each stream can have up to 10 tags.

DecreaseStreamRetentionPeriod.description: Decreases the stream\'s retention period, which is the length of time data records are accessible after they are added to the stream.

DeleteStream.description: Deletes a stream and all its shards and data.

DeregisterStreamConsumer.description: Deregisters a stream consumer with a Kinesis data stream.

IncreaseStreamRetentionPeriod.description: Increases the stream\'s retention period, which is the length of time data records are accessible after they are added to the stream.

MergeShards.description: Merges two adjacent shards in a stream and combines them into a single shard to reduce the stream\'s capacity to ingest and transport data.

PutRecord.description: Writes a single data record from a producer into an Amazon Kinesis stream.

PutRecords.description: Writes multiple data records from a producer into an Amazon Kinesis stream in a single call (also referred to as a PutRecords request).

RegisterStreamConsumer.description: Registers a stream consumer with a Kinesis data stream.

UpdateShardCount.description: Updates the shard count of the specified stream to the specified number of shards.

DescribeStream.description: Describe the specified Kinesis video stream.

ListFragments.description: List the fragments from archival storage based on the pagination token or selector type with range specified.

GetDataEndpoint.description: Gets an endpoint for a specified stream for either reading or writing media data to Kinesis Video Streams.

GetHLSStreamingSessionURL.description: Creates a URL for HLS video streaming.

GetMedia.description: Returns media content of a Kinesis video stream.

GetMediaForFragmentList.description: Read and return media data only from persisted storage.

ListTagsForStream.description: Fetch the tags associated with Kinesis video stream.

TagStream.description: Attach set of tags to your Kinesis video streams.

UntagStream.description: Remove one or more tags from your Kinesis video streams.

DeleteStream.description: Delete an existing Kinesis video stream.

PutMedia.description: Send media data to a Kinesis video stream.

UpdateDataRetention.description: Update the data retention period of your Kinesis video stream.

kms.description: Managed Creation and Control of Encryption Keys

ListAliases.description: Grants permission to view the aliases that are defined in the account. Aliases are optional display names that you can associate with customer master keys.

ListGrants.description: Grants permission to view all grants for a customer master key.

ListKeyPolicies.description: Grants permission to view the names of key policies for a customer master key.

ListKeys.description: Grants permission to view the key ID and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of all customer master keys in the account.

ListRetirableGrants.description: Grants permission to view grants in which the specified principal is the retiring principal. Other principals might be able to retire the grant and this principal might be able to retire other grants.

CreateGrant.description: Grants permission to add a grant to a customer master key. You can use grants to add permissions without changing the key policy or IAM policy.

PutKeyPolicy.description: Grants permission to replace the key policy for the specified customer master key.

RetireGrant.description: Grants permission to retire a grant. The RetireGrant operation is typically called by the grant user after they complete the tasks that the grant allowed them to perform.

RevokeGrant.description: Grants permission to revoke a grant, which denies permission for all operations that depend on the grant.

DescribeKey.description: Grants permission to view detailed information about a customer master key.

GetKeyPolicy.description: Grants permission to view the key policy for the specified customer master key.

GetKeyRotationStatus.description: Grants permission to determine whether automatic key rotation is enabled on the customer master key.

GetParametersForImport.description: Grants permission to get data that is required to import cryptographic material into a customer managed key, including a public key and import token.

ListResourceTags.description: Grants permission to view all tags that are attached to a customer master key.

TagResource.description: Grants permission to create or update tags that are attached to a customer master key.

UntagResource.description: Grants permission to delete tags that are attached to a customer master key.

CancelKeyDeletion.description: Grants permission to cancel the scheduled deletion of a customer master key.

CreateAlias.description: Grants permission to create an alias for a customer master key (CMK). Aliases are optional display names that you can associate with CMKs.

CreateKey.description: Grants permission to create a customer master key that can be used to protect data keys and other sensitive information.

Decrypt.description: Grants permission to decrypt ciphertext that was encrypted under a customer master key.

DeleteAlias.description: Grants permission to delete an alias, which is an optional friendly name for a customer master key.

DeleteImportedKeyMaterial.description: Grants permission to delete cryptographic material that you imported into a customer master key. This action makes the key unusable.

DisableKey.description: Grants permission to disable a customer master key, which prevents it from being used in cryptographic operations.

DisableKeyRotation.description: Grants permission to disable automatic rotation of a customer managed customer master key.

EnableKey.description: Grants permission to change the state of a customer master key (CMK) to enabled. This allows the CMK to be used in cryptographic operations.

EnableKeyRotation.description: Grants permission to enable automatic rotation of the cryptographic material in a customer master key.

Encrypt.description: Grants permission to use the specified customer master key to encrypt data and data keys.

GenerateDataKey.description: Grants permission to use the customer master key to generate data keys. You can use the data keys to encrypt data outside of AWS KMS.

GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext.description: Grants permission to use the customer master key to generate a data key. Unlike the GenerateDataKey operation, this operation returns an encrypted data key without a plaintext version of the data key.

GenerateRandom.description: Grants permission to get a cryptographically secure random byte string from AWS KMS.

ImportKeyMaterial.description: Grants permission to import cryptographic material into a customer master key.

ReEncryptFrom.description: Grants permission to decrypt data as part of the process that decrypts and reencrypts the data within AWS KMS.

ReEncryptTo.description: Grants permission to encrypt data as part of the process that decrypts and reencrypts the data within AWS KMS.

ScheduleKeyDeletion.description: Grants permission to schedule deletion of a customer master key.

UpdateAlias.description: Grants permission to associate an alias with a different customer master key.

UpdateKeyDescription.description: Grants permission to delete or change the description of a customer master key.

kms:BypassPolicyLockoutSafetyCheck.description: Controls access to the CreateKey and PutKeyPolicy operations based on the value of the BypassPolicyLockoutSafetyCheck parameter in the request.

kms:CallerAccount.description: Controls access to specified AWS KMS operations based on the AWS account ID of the caller. You can use this condition to allow or deny access to to all IAM users and roles in an AWS account in a single policy statement.

kms:EncryptionContextKeys.description: Controls access based on the presence of specified keys in the encryption context. The encryption context is an optional element in a cryptographic operation.

kms:ExpirationModel.description: Controls access to the ImportKeyMaterial operation based on the value of the ExpirationModel parameter in the request.

kms:GrantConstraintType.description: Controls access to the CreateGrant operation based on the grant constraint in the request.

kms:GrantIsForAWSResource.description: Controls access to the CreateGrant operation when the request comes from a specified AWS service.

kms:GrantOperations.description: Controls access to the CreateGrant operation based on the operations in the grant.

kms:GranteePrincipal.description: Controls access to the CreateGrant operation based on the grantee principal in the grant.

kms:KeyOrigin.description: Controls access to the CreateKey operation based on the value of the Origin parameter in the request. The Origin parameter determines whether AWS KMS generates cryptographic material for the key or imports it.

kms:ReEncryptOnSameKey.description: Controls access to the ReEncrypt operation when it uses the same customer master key that was used for the Encrypt operation.

kms:RetiringPrincipal.description: Controls access to the CreateGrant operation based on the retiring principal in the grant.

kms:ValidTo.description: Controls access to the ImportKeyMaterial operation based on the value of the ValidTo parameter in the request. You can use this condition key to allow users to import key material only when it expires by the specified date.

kms:ViaService.description: Controls access when a request made on the principal\'s behalf comes from a specified AWS service.

kms:WrappingAlgorithm.description: Controls access to the GetParametersForImport operation based on the value of the WrappingAlgorithm parameter in the request.

kms:WrappingKeySpec.description: Controls access to the GetParametersForImport operation based on the value of the WrappingKeySpec parameter in the request.

You can use a blueprint to create a new instance already running a specific operating system, as well as a preinstalled app or development stack. The software each instance is running depends on the blueprint image you choose.

GetBundles.description: Returns the list of bundles that are available for purchase. A bundle describes the specifications for your instance.

DetectModerationLabels.description: Detects moderation labels within input image.

DetectText.description: Detects text in the input image and converts it into machine-readable text.

GetCelebrityInfo.description: Gets the name and additional information about a celebrity based on his or her Rekognition ID.

GetCelebrityRecognition.description: Gets the celebrity recognition results for a Rekognition Video analysis started by StartCelebrityRecognition.

GetContentModeration.description: Gets the content moderation analysis results for a Rekognition Video analysis started by StartContentModeration.

GetFaceDetection.description: Gets face detection results for a Rekognition Video analysis started by StartFaceDetection.

GetFaceSearch.description: Gets the face search results for Rekognition Video face search started by StartFaceSearch.

GetLabelDetection.description: Gets the label detection results of a Rekognition Video analysis started by StartLabelDetection.

GetPersonTracking.description: Gets information about people detected within a video.

ListCollections.description: Returns a list of collection IDs in your account.

ListFaces.description: Returns metadata for faces in the specified collection.

RecognizeCelebrities.description: Returns an array of celebrities recognized in the input image.

SearchFaces.description: For a given input face ID, searches the specified collection for matching faces.

SearchFacesByImage.description: For a given input image, first detects the largest face in the image, and then searches the specified collection for matching faces.

CreateCollection.description: Creates a collection in an AWS region. You can then add faces to the collection using the IndexFaces API.

CreateStreamProcessor.description: Creates an Amazon Rekognition stream processor that you can use to detect and recognize faces in a streaming video.

DeleteCollection.description: Deletes the specified collection. Note that this operation removes all faces in the collection.

DeleteStreamProcessor.description: Deletes the stream processor identified by Name.

IndexFaces.description: Detects faces in the input image and adds them to the specified collection.

StartCelebrityRecognition.description: Starts asynchronous recognition of celebrities in a video.

StartContentModeration.description: Starts asynchronous detection of explicit or suggestive adult content in a video.

StartFaceDetection.description: Starts asynchronous detection of faces in a video.

StartFaceSearch.description: Starts the asynchronous search for faces in a collection that match the faces of persons detected in a video.

StartLabelDetection.description: Starts asynchronous detection of labels in a video.

StartPersonTracking.description: Starts the asynchronous tracking of persons in a video.

StopStreamProcessor.description: Stops a running stream processor that was created by CreateStreamProcessor.

robomaker.description: Develop, test, and deploy robotics applications

CreateFleet.description: Create a fleet that represents a logical group of robots running the same robot application

CreateRobot.description: Create a robot that can be registered to a fleet

CreateRobotApplicationVersion.description: Create a snapshot of a robot application

CreateSimulationApplicationVersion.description: Create a snapshot of a robot application

DeregisterRobot.description: Deregister a robot from a fleet

RegisterRobot.description: Register a robot to a fleet

SyncDeploymentJob.description: Ensures the most recently deployed robot application is deployed to all robots in the fleet

GetChange.description: Grants permission to get the current status of a request to create, update, or delete one or more records

GetCheckerIpRanges.description: Grants permission to get a list of the IP ranges that are used by Route 53 health checkers to check the health of your resources

GetGeoLocation.description: Grants permission to get information about whether a specified geographic location is supported for Route 53 geolocation records

GetHealthCheckCount.description: Grants permission to get the number of health checks that are associated with the current AWS account

GetHealthCheckLastFailureReason.description: Grants permission to get the reason that a specified health check failed most recently

GetHealthCheckStatus.description: Grants permission to get the status of a specified health check

GetHostedZone.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified hosted zone including the four name servers that Route 53 assigned to the hosted zone

GetHostedZoneCount.description: Grants permission to get the number of hosted zones that are associated with the current AWS account

GetReusableDelegationSet.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified reusable delegation set, including the four name servers that are assigned to the delegation set

ListGeoLocations.description: Grants permission to get a list of geographic locations that Route 53 supports for geolocation

ListHealthChecks.description: Grants permission to get a list of the health checks that are associated with the current AWS account

ListHostedZones.description: Grants permission to get a list of the public and private hosted zones that are associated with the current AWS account

ListHostedZonesByName.description: Grants permission to get a list of your hosted zones in lexicographic order. Hosted zones are sorted by name with the labels reversed, for example, com.example.www.

ListQueryLoggingConfigs.description: Grants permission to list the configurations for DNS query logging that are associated with the current AWS account or the configuration that is associated with a specified hosted zone.

ListResourceRecordSets.description: Grants permission to list the records in a specified hosted zone

ListReusableDelegationSets.description: Grants permission to list the reusable delegation sets that are associated with the current AWS account.

GetAccountLimit.description: Grants permission to get the specified limit for the current account, for example, the maximum number of health checks that you can create using the account

GetHealthCheck.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified health check

GetHostedZoneLimit.description: Grants permission to get the specified limit for a specified hosted zone

GetQueryLoggingConfig.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified configuration for DNS query logging

GetReusableDelegationSetLimit.description: Grants permission to get the maximum number of hosted zones that you can associate with the specified reusable delegation set

GetTrafficPolicy.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified traffic policy version

GetTrafficPolicyInstance.description: Grants permission to get information about a specified traffic policy instance

GetTrafficPolicyInstanceCount.description: Grants permission to get the number of traffic policy instances that are associated with the current AWS account

ListTagsForResource.description: Grants permission to list tags for one health check or hosted zone

ListTagsForResources.description: Grants permission to list tags for up to 10 health checks or hosted zones

ListTrafficPolicies.description: Grants permission to get information about the latest version for every traffic policy that is associated with the current AWS account. Policies are listed in the order in which they were created.

ListTrafficPolicyInstances.description: Grants permission to get information about the traffic policy instances that you created by using the current AWS account

ListTrafficPolicyInstancesByHostedZone.description: Grants permission to get information about the traffic policy instances that you created in a specified hosted zone

ListTrafficPolicyInstancesByPolicy.description: Grants permission to get information about the traffic policy instances that you created using a specified traffic policy version

ListTrafficPolicyVersions.description: Grants permission to get information about all the versions for a specified traffic policy

ListVPCAssociationAuthorizations.description: Grants permission to get a list of the VPCs that were created by other accounts and that can be associated with a specified hosted zone

TestDNSAnswer.description: Grants permission to get the value that Route 53 returns in response to a DNS query for a specified record name and type

ChangeTagsForResource.description: Grants permission to add, edit, or delete tags for a health check or a hosted zone

AssociateVPCWithHostedZone.description: Grants permission to associate an additional Amazon VPC with a private hosted zone

ChangeResourceRecordSets.description: Grants permission to create, update, or delete a record, which contains authoritative DNS information for a specified domain or subdomain name

CreateHealthCheck.description: Grants permission to create a new health check, which monitors the health and performance of your web applications, web servers, and other resources

CreateHostedZone.description: Grants permission to create a public hosted zone, which you use to specify how the Domain Name System (DNS) routes traffic on the Internet for a domain, such as example.com, and its subdomains

CreateQueryLoggingConfig.description: Grants permission to create a configuration for DNS query logging

CreateReusableDelegationSet.description: Grants permission to create a delegation set (a group of four name servers) that can be reused by multiple hosted zones

CreateTrafficPolicy.description: Grants permission to create a traffic policy, which you use to create multiple DNS records for one domain name (such as example.com) or one subdomain name (such as www.example.com)

CreateTrafficPolicyInstance.description: Grants permission to create records in a specified hosted zone based on the settings in a specified traffic policy version

CreateTrafficPolicyVersion.description: Grants permission to create a new version of an existing traffic policy

CreateVPCAssociationAuthorization.description: Grants permission to authorize the AWS account that created a specified VPC to submit an AssociateVPCWithHostedZone request, which associates the VPC with a specified hosted zone that was created by a different account

DeleteHealthCheck.description: Grants permission to delete a health check

DeleteHostedZone.description: Grants permission to delete a hosted zone

DeleteQueryLoggingConfig.description: Grants permission to delete a configuration for DNS query logging

DeleteReusableDelegationSet.description: Grants permission to delete a reusable delegation set

DeleteTrafficPolicy.description: Grants permission to delete a traffic policy

DeleteTrafficPolicyInstance.description: Grants permission to delete a traffic policy instance and all the records that Route 53 created when you created the instance

DeleteVPCAssociationAuthorization.description: Grants permission to remove authorization for associating an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud with a Route 53 private hosted zone

DisassociateVPCFromHostedZone.description: Grants permission to disassociate an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud from a Route 53 private hosted zone

UpdateHealthCheck.description: Grants permission to update an existing health check

UpdateHostedZoneComment.description: Grants permission to update the comment for a specified hosted zone

UpdateTrafficPolicyComment.description: Grants permission to update the comment for a specified traffic policy version

UpdateTrafficPolicyInstance.description: Grants permission to update the records in a specified hosted zone that were created based on the settings in a specified traffic policy version

ListAllMyBuckets.description: Returns a list of all buckets owned by the authenticated sender of the request.

DeleteBucketPolicy.description: Delete the policy on a specified bucket

PutBucketPolicy.description: Add to or replace a policy on a bucket.

PutBucketPublicAccessBlock.description: Create or modify the PublicAccessBlock configuration for an specific S3 bucket.

PutObjectAcl.description: Set the access control list (ACL) permissions for an object that already exists in a bucket.

PutObjectVersionAcl.description: The ACL of an object is set at the object version level.

GetAccelerateConfiguration.description: This implementation of the GET operation uses the accelerate subresource to return the Transfer Acceleration state of a bucket, which is either Enabled or Suspended.

GetAccountPublicAccessBlock.description: Retrieve the PublicAccessBlock configuration for an AWS account

GetAnalyticsConfiguration.description: This implementation of the GET operation returns an analytics configuration (identified by the analytics configuration ID) from the bucket.

GetBucketAcl.description: Return the access control list (ACL) of a bucket.

GetBucketCORS.description: Returns the cors configuration information set for the bucket.

GetBucketLogging.description: Return the logging status of a bucket and the permissions users have to view and modify that status.

GetBucketNotification.description: Return the notification configuration of a bucket.

GetBucketPolicy.description: Return the policy of a specified bucket.

GetBucketPolicyStatus.description: Retrieve the policy status for an specific S3 bucket, indicating whether the bucket is public.

GetBucketPublicAccessBlock.description: Retrieve the PublicAccessBlock configuration for a specific S3 bucket.

GetBucketRequestPayment.description: Return the request payment configuration of a bucket.

GetBucketTagging.description: Return the tag set associated with the bucket.

GetBucketVersioning.description: Return the versioning state of a bucket.

GetBucketWebsite.description: Returns the website configuration associated with a bucket.

GetEncryptionConfiguration.description: Returns the encryption configuration information set on the bucket.

GetInventoryConfiguration.description: This implementation of the GET operation returns an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory configuration ID) from the bucket.

GetLifecycleConfiguration.description: Returns the lifecycle configuration information set on the bucket.

GetMetricsConfiguration.description: Gets a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from the bucket. Note that this doesn\'t include the daily storage metrics.

GetObjectAcl.description: Return the access control list (ACL) of an object.

GetObjectTagging.description: This implementation of the GET operation returns the tags associated with an object. You send the GET request against the tagging subresource associated with the object.

GetObjectTorrent.description: return torrent files from a bucket.

GetObjectVersion.description: To return a different version, use the versionId subresource.

GetObjectVersionAcl.description: To return ACL information about a different version, use the versionId subresource.

GetObjectVersionTagging.description: GET Object tagging (for a Specific Version of the Object)

GetObjectVersionTorrent.description: To return Torrent files about a different version, use the versionId subresource.

GetReplicationConfiguration.description: Returns the replication configuration information set on the bucket.

ListBucketVersions.description: Use the versions subresource to list metadata about all of the versions of objects in a bucket.

ListMultipartUploadParts.description: Lists the parts that have been uploaded for a specific multipart upload.

DeleteObjectTagging.description: This implementation of the DELETE operation uses the tagging subresource to remove the entire tag set from the specified object.

DeleteObjectVersionTagging.description: DELETE Object tagging (for a Specific Version of the Object)

PutBucketTagging.description: Add a set of tags to an existing bucket.

PutObjectTagging.description: This implementation of the PUT operation uses the tagging subresource to add a set of tags to an existing object.

PutObjectVersionTagging.description: PUT Object tagging (for a Specific Version of the Object)

DeleteBucket.description: Deletes the bucket named in the URI

DeleteBucketWebsite.description: Removes the website configuration for a bucket.

DeleteObject.description: Removes the null version (if there is one) of an object and inserts a delete marker, which becomes the current version of the object.

DeleteObjectVersion.description: To remove a specific version of a object, you must be the bucket owner and you must use the versionId subresource.

PutAccelerateConfiguration.description: This implementation of the PUT operation uses the accelerate subresource to set the Transfer Acceleration state of an existing bucket.

PutAnalyticsConfiguration.description: This implementation of the PUT operation adds an analytics configuration (identified by the analytics ID) to the bucket. You can have up to 1,000 analytics configurations per bucket.

PutBucketCORS.description: Sets the cors configuration for your bucket.

PutBucketLogging.description: Set the logging parameters for a bucket.

PutBucketNotification.description: Enables you to receive notifications when certain events happen in your bucket.

PutBucketRequestPayment.description: Set the request payment configuration of a bucket.

PutBucketVersioning.description: Set the versioning state of an existing bucket.

PutBucketWebsite.description: Sets the configuration of the website that is specified in the website subresource.

PutEncryptionConfiguration.description: Sets the encryption configuration for the bucket.

PutInventoryConfiguration.description: This implementation of the PUT operation adds an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory ID) to the bucket. You can have up to 1,000 inventory configurations per bucket.

PutLifecycleConfiguration.description: Creates a new lifecycle configuration for the bucket or replaces an existing lifecycle configuration.

PutMetricsConfiguration.description: Sets or updates a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from the bucket.

PutObject.description: Adds an object to a bucket.

PutReplicationConfiguration.description: In a versioning-enabled bucket, this operation creates a new replication configuration (or replaces an existing one, if present).

RestoreObject.description: Restores a temporary copy of an archived object.

s3:ExistingObjectTag/<key>.description: Enables you to verify that an existing object tag has the specific tag key and value.

s3:LocationConstraint.description: Enables you to restrict users to creating buckets in only a specific region.

s3:RequestObjectTag/<key>.description: Restrict the tag keys and values that you want to allow on objects.

s3:RequestObjectTagKeys.description: restrict the tag keys that you want to allow on objects.

s3:VersionId.description: Enables you to limit the permission for the s3:PutObjectVersionTagging action to a specific object version.

s3:delimiter.description: Enables you to require the user to specify the delimiter parameter in the GET Bucket Object versions request.

s3:locationconstraint.description: Enables you to restrict the user to creating a bucket in only a specific region.

s3:max-keys.description: Enables you to limit the number of keys Amazon S3 returns in response to ListBucket requests by requiring the user to specify the max-keys parameter.

s3:prefix.description: Enables you to limit the response of the ListBucket API to key names with specific prefix.

s3:x-amz-acl.description: Enables you to require specific access permissions when uploading an object.

s3:x-amz-copy-source.description: Enables you to restrict the copy source to a specific bucket, a specific folder in the bucket, or a specific object in a bucket.

s3:x-amz-metadata-directive.description: Enables you to enforce certain behavior (COPY vs. REPLACE) when objects are uploaded.

s3:x-amz-server-side-encryption.description: Enables you to require the user to specify this header in the request to ensure that objects the user uploads are encrypted when they are saved.

sagemaker.description: Build, Train, and Deploy Machine Learning Models at Scale

ListHyperParameterTuningJobs.description: Lists hyper parameter tuning jobs that was created using Amazon SageMaker.

ListModels.description: Lists the models created with the CreateModel API.

ListNotebookInstanceLifecycleConfigs.description: Lists notebook instance lifecycle configurations that can be deployed using Amazon SageMaker.

ListNotebookInstances.description: Returns a list of the Amazon SageMaker notebook instances in the requester\'s account in an AWS Region.

ListTags.description: Returns the tag set associated with the specified resource.

ListTrainingJobsForHyperParameterTuningJ.description: Lists training jobs for a hyper parameter tuning job that was created using Amazon SageMaker.

CreatePresignedNotebookInstanceUrl.description: Returns a URL that you can use from your browser to connect to the Notebook Instance.

DescribeCodeRepository.description: Returns information about a code repository.

DescribeCompilationJob.description: Returns information about a compilation job.

DescribeEndpoint.description: Returns the description of an endpoint.

DescribeEndpointConfig.description: Returns the description of an endpoint configuration, which was created using the CreateEndpointConfig API.

DescribeHyperParameterTuningJob.description: Describes a hyper parameter tuning job that was created via CreateHyperParameterTuningJob API.

DescribeLabelingJob.description: Returns information about a labeling job.

DescribeModel.description: Describes a model that you created using the CreateModel API.

DescribeModelPackage.description: Returns information about a model package.

DescribeNotebookInstance.description: Returns information about a notebook instance.

DescribeNotebookInstanceLifecycleConfig.description: Describes an notebook instance lifecycle configuration that was created via CreateNotebookInstanceLifecycleConfig API.

DescribeSubscribedWorkteam.description: Returns information about a subscribed workteam.

DescribeTrainingJob.description: Returns information about a training job.

DescribeTransformJob.description: Returns information about a transform job.

GetSearchSuggestions.description: Get search suggestions when provided with keyword.

InvokeEndpoint.description: After you deploy a model into production using Amazon SageMaker hosting services, your client applications use this API to get inferences from the model hosted at the specified endpoint.

AddTags.description: Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified Amazon SageMaker resource.

DeleteTags.description: Deletes the specified set of tags from an Amazon SageMaker resource.

CreateEndpoint.description: Creates an endpoint using the endpoint configuration specified in the request.

CreateEndpointConfig.description: Creates an endpoint configuration that can be deployed using Amazon SageMaker hosting services.

CreateHyperParameterTuningJob.description: Creates hyper parameter tuning job that can be deployed using Amazon SageMaker.

CreateModel.description: Creates a model in Amazon SageMaker. In the request, you specify a name for the model and describe one or more containers.

CreateNotebookInstance.description: Creates an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance. A notebook instance is an Amazon EC2 instance running on a Jupyter Notebook.

CreateNotebookInstanceLifecycleConfig.description: Creates an notebook instance lifecycle configuration that can be deployed using Amazon SageMaker.

CreateTrainingJob.description: Starts a model training job. After training completes, Amazon SageMaker saves the resulting model artifacts and other optional output to an Amazon S3 location that you specify.

CreateTransformJob.description: Starts a transform job. After the results are obtained, Amazon SageMaker saves them to an Amazon S3 location that you specify.

DeleteEndpoint.description: Deletes an endpoint. Amazon SageMaker frees up all the resources that were deployed when the endpoint was created.

DeleteEndpointConfig.description: Deletes the endpoint configuration created using the CreateEndpointConfig API. The DeleteEndpointConfig API deletes only the specified configuration. It does not delete any endpoints created using the configuration.

DeleteModel.description: Deletes a model created using the CreateModel API. The DeleteModel API deletes only the model entry in Amazon SageMaker that you created by calling the CreateModel API. It does not delete model artifacts, inference code, or the IAM role that you specified when creating the model.

DeleteNotebookInstance.description: Deletes an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance. Before you can delete a notebook instance, you must call the StopNotebookInstance API.

DeleteNotebookInstanceLifecycleConfig.description: Deletes an notebook instance lifecycle configuration that can be deployed using Amazon SageMaker.

StartNotebookInstance.description: Launches an EC2 instance with the latest version of the libraries and attaches your EBS volume.

StopHyperParameterTuningJob.description: Stops a running hyper parameter tuning job create via the CreateHyperParameterTuningJob.

StopNotebookInstance.description: Terminates the EC2 instance. Before terminating the instance, Amazon SageMaker disconnects the EBS volume from it. Amazon SageMaker preserves the EBS volume.

StopTrainingJob.description: Stops a training job. To stop a job, Amazon SageMaker sends the algorithm the SIGTERM signal, which delays job termination for 120 seconds.

StopTransformJob.description: Stops a transform job. When Amazon SageMaker receives a StopTransformJob request, the status of the job changes to Stopping. After Amazon SageMaker stops the job, the status is set to Stopped

UpdateEndpoint.description: Updates an endpoint to use the endpoint configuration specified in the request.

UpdateEndpointWeightsAndCapacities.description: Updates variant weight, capacity, or both of one or more variants associated with an endpoint.

UpdateNotebookInstance.description: Updates a notebook instance. Notebook instance updates include upgrading or downgrading the EC2 instance used for your notebook instance to accommodate changes in your workload requirements. You can also update the VPC security groups.

aws:RequestTag/tag-key.description: A key that is present in the request the user makes to the SageMaker service.

aws:TagKeys.description: The list of all the tag key names associated with the resource in the request.

sagemaker:ResourceTag/.description: The preface string for a tag key and value pair attached to a resource.

sagemaker:ResourceTag/tag-key.description: A tag key and value pair.

ListSecrets.description: Enables the user to list the available secrets.

DeleteResourcePolicy.description: Enables the user to delete the resource policy attached to a secret.

PutResourcePolicy.description: Enables the user to attach a resource policy to a secret.

DescribeSecret.description: Enables the user to retrieve the metadata about a secret, but not the encrypted data.

GetRandomPassword.description: Enables the user to generate a random string for use in password creation.

GetResourcePolicy.description: Enables the user to get the resource policy attached to a secret.

GetSecretValue.description: Enables the user to retrieve and decrypt the encrypted data.

ListSecretVersionIds.description: Enables the user to list the available versions of a secret.

CreateSecret.description: Enables the user to create a secret that stores encrypted data that can be queried and rotated.

TagResource.description: Enables the user to add tags to a secret.

UntagResource.description: Enables the user to remove tags from a secret.

CancelRotateSecret.description: Enables the user to cancel an in-progress secret rotation.

DeleteSecret.description: Enables the user to delete a secret.

PutSecretValue.description: Enables the user to create a new version of the secret with new encrypted data.

RestoreSecret.description: Enables the user to cancel deletion of a secret.

RotateSecret.description: Enables the user to start rotation of a secret.

UpdateSecret.description: Enables the user to update a secret with new metadata or with a new version of the encrypted data.

UpdateSecretVersionStage.description: Enables the user to move a stage from one secret to another.

aws:RequestTag/tag-key.description: Filters access by a key that is present in the request the user makes to the Secrets Manager service.

aws:TagKeys.description: Filters access by the list of all the tag key namespresent in the request the user makes to the Secrets Manager service.

secretsmanager:Description.description: Filters access by the description text in the request.

secretsmanager:ForceDeleteWithoutRecover.description: Filters access by whether the secret is to be deleted immediately without any recovery window.

secretsmanager:KmsKeyId.description: Filters access by the ARN of the KMS key in the request.

secretsmanager:Name.description: Filters access by the friendly name of the secret in the request.

secretsmanager:RecoveryWindowInDays.description: Filters access by the number of days that Secrets Manager waits before it can delete the secret.

secretsmanager:ResourceTag/tag-key.description: Filters access by a tag key and value pair.

secretsmanager:RotationLambdaARN.description: Filters access by the ARN of the rotation Lambda function in the request.

secretsmanager:SecretId.description: Filters access by the SecretID value in the request.

secretsmanager:VersionId.description: Filters access by the unique identifier of the version of the secret in the request.

secretsmanager:VersionStage.description: Filters access by the list of version stages in the request.

secretsmanager:resource/AllowRotationLam.description: Filters access by the ARN of the rotation Lambda function associated with the secret.

GetInsights.description: Lists and describes insights that are specified by insight ARNs.

ListEnabledProductsForImport.description: Lists all Security Hub integrated third-party findings providers.

ListInvitations.description: Lists all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current AWS account.

ListMembers.description: Lists details about all member accounts for the current Security Hub master account.

GetFindings.description: Lists and describes Security Hub-aggregated findings that are specified by filter attributes.

GetInsightResults.description: Lists the results of the Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.

GetMasterAccount.description: Provides the details for the Security Hub master account to the current member account.

GetMembers.description: Returns the details on the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs.

AcceptInvitation.description: Accepts the invitation to be monitored by a master Security Hub account.

BatchEnableStandards.description: Enables the standards specified by the standards ARNs.

BatchImportFindings.description: Imports security findings that are generated by the integrated third-party products into Security Hub.

DeleteInvitations.description: Deletes invitations that are sent to this AWS account (invitee) by the AWS accounts (inviters) that are specified by their account IDs.

DisableSecurityHub.description: Disables the AWS Security Hub Service.

EnableImportFindingsForProduct.description: Enables you to import findings generated by the integrated third-party providers into Security Hub.

EnableSecurityHub.description: Enables the AWS Security Hub service.

InviteMembers.description: Invites other AWS accounts to enable Security Hub and become Security Hub member accounts. When an account accepts the invitation and becomes a member account, the master account can view and manage the Security Hub findings of the member account.

UpdateFindings.description: Updates the AWS Security Hub-aggregated findings specified by the filter attributes.

UpdateInsight.description: Updates the AWS Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.

ListFileShares.description: This operation gets a list of the file shares for a specific file gateway, or the list of file shares that belong to the calling user account.

ListTagsForResource.description: This operation lists the tags that have been added to the specified resource.

AddTagsToResource.description: This operation adds one or more tags to the specified resource.

CreateSnapshot.description: This operation initiates a snapshot of a volume.

CreateTapeWithBarcode.description: Creates a virtual tape by using your own barcode.

UpdateNFSFileShare.description: This operation updates a file share.

UpdateVTLDeviceType.description: This operation updates the type of medium changer in a gateway-VTL.

ListSubscribedRuleGroups.description: Returns an array of RuleGroup objects that you are subscribed to.

ListWebACLs.description: Returns an array of WebACLSummary objects in the response.

ListXssMatchSets.description: Returns an array of XssMatchSet objects.

CreateWebACL.description: Creates a WebACL, which contains the Rules that identify the CloudFront web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

DeletePermissionPolicy.description: Permanently deletes an IAM policy from the specified RuleGroup.

PutPermissionPolicy.description: Attaches a IAM policy to the specified resource. The only supported use for this action is to share a RuleGroup across accounts.

UpdateWebACL.description: Inserts or deletes ActivatedRule objects in a WebACL.

GetByteMatchSet.description: Returns the ByteMatchSet specified by ByteMatchSetId.

GetChangeToken.description: When you want to create, update, or delete AWS WAF objects, get a change token and include the change token in the create, update, or delete request.

GetChangeTokenStatus.description: Returns the status of a ChangeToken that you got by calling GetChangeToken.

GetGeoMatchSet.description: Returns the GeoMatchSet specified by GeoMatchSetId.

GetIPSet.description: Returns the IPSet that is specified by IPSetId.

GetPermissionPolicy.description: Returns the IAM policy attached to the RuleGroup.

GetRateBasedRule.description: Returns the RateBasedRule that is specified by the RuleId that you included in the GetRateBasedRule request.

GetRateBasedRuleManagedKeys.description: Returns an array of IP addresses currently being blocked by the RateBasedRule that is specified by the RuleId.

GetRegexMatchSet.description: Returns the RegexMatchSet specified by RegexMatchSetId.

GetRegexPatternSet.description: Returns the RegexPatternSet specified by RegexPatternSetId.

GetRule.description: Returns the Rule that is specified by the RuleId that you included in the GetRule request.

GetRuleGroup.description: Returns the RuleGroup that is specified by the RuleGroupId that you included in the GetRuleGroup request.

GetSampledRequests.description: Gets detailed information about a specified number of requests--a sample--that AWS WAF randomly selects from among the first 5,000 requests that your AWS resource received during a time range that you choose.

GetSizeConstraintSet.description: Returns the SizeConstraintSet specified by SizeConstraintSetId.

GetSqlInjectionMatchSet.description: Returns the SqlInjectionMatchSet that is specified by SqlInjectionMatchSetId.

GetWebACL.description: Returns the WebACL that is specified by WebACLId.

GetXssMatchSet.description: Returns the XssMatchSet that is specified by XssMatchSetId.

CreateGeoMatchSet.description: Creates a GeoMatchSet, which you use to specify which web requests you want to allow or block based on the country that the requests originate from.

CreateIPSet.description: Creates an IPSet, which you use to specify which web requests you want to allow or block based on the IP addresses that the requests originate from.

CreateRateBasedRule.description: Creates a RateBasedRule, which contains a RateLimit specifying the maximum number of requests that AWS WAF allows from a specified IP address in a five-minute period.

CreateRegexMatchSet.description: Creates a RegexMatchSet, which you use to specify which web requests you want to allow or block based on the regex patterns you specified in a RegexPatternSet.

CreateRegexPatternSet.description: Creates a RegexPatternSet, which you use to specify the regular expression (regex) pattern that you want AWS WAF to search for.

CreateRule.description: Creates a Rule, which contains the IPSet objects, ByteMatchSet objects, and other predicates that identify the requests that you want to block.

CreateRuleGroup.description: Creates a RuleGroup. A rule group is a collection of predefined rules that you add to a WebACL.

CreateSizeConstraintSet.description: Creates a SizeConstraintSet, which you use to identify the part of a web request that you want to check for length.

CreateSqlInjectionMatchSet.description: Creates a SqlInjectionMatchSet, which you use to allow, block, or count requests that contain snippets of SQL code in a specified part of web requests.

CreateXssMatchSet.description: Creates an XssMatchSet, which you use to allow, block, or count requests that contain cross-site scripting attacks in the specified part of web requests.

UpdateByteMatchSet.description: Inserts or deletes ByteMatchTuple objects (filters) in a ByteMatchSet.

UpdateGeoMatchSet.description: Inserts or deletes GeoMatchConstraint objects in a GeoMatchSet.

UpdateIPSet.description: Inserts or deletes IPSetDescriptor objects in an IPSet.

UpdateRateBasedRule.description: Inserts or deletes Predicate objects in a rule and updates the RateLimit in the rule.

UpdateRegexMatchSet.description: Inserts or deletes RegexMatchTuple objects (filters) in a RegexMatchSet.

UpdateRegexPatternSet.description: Inserts or deletes RegexPatternStrings in a RegexPatternSet.

UpdateRule.description: Inserts or deletes Predicate objects in a Rule.

UpdateRuleGroup.description: Inserts or deletes ActivatedRule objects in a RuleGroup.

UpdateSizeConstraintSet.description: Inserts or deletes SizeConstraint objects (filters) in a SizeConstraintSet.

UpdateSqlInjectionMatchSet.description: Inserts or deletes SqlInjectionMatchTuple objects (filters) in a SqlInjectionMatchSet.

UpdateXssMatchSet.description: Inserts or deletes XssMatchTuple objects (filters) in an XssMatchSet.

ListWorkloads.description: Lists the workloads in this account.

DescribeDocumentVersions.description: Retrieves the document versions for the specified document.

DescribeFolderContents.description: Describes the contents of the specified folder, including its documents and sub-folders.

DescribeResourcePermissions.description: Describes the permissions of a specified resource.

DescribeUsers.description: Describes the specified users. You can describe all users or filter the results (for example, by status or organization).

GetDocumentPath.description: Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the requested document.

GetDocumentVersion.description: Retrieves version metadata for the specified document.

GetFolder.description: Retrieves the metadata of the specified folder.

GetFolderPath.description: Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the specified folder.

AbortDocumentVersionUpload.description: Aborts the upload of the specified document version that was previously initiated by InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.

ActivateUser.description: Activates the specified user. Only active users can access Amazon WorkDocs.

AddResourcePermissions.description: Creates a set of permissions for the specified folder or document.

CreateFolder.description: Creates a folder with the specified name and parent folder.

CreateNotificationSubscription.description: Configure WorkDocs to use Amazon SNS notifications.

CreateUser.description: Creates a user in a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory.

DeactivateUser.description: Deactivates the specified user, which revokes the user\'s access to Amazon WorkDocs.

DeleteDocument.description: Permanently deletes the specified document and its associated metadata.

DeleteFolder.description: Permanently deletes the specified folder and its contents.

DeleteFolderContents.description: Deletes the contents of the specified folder.

DeleteNotificationSubscription.description: Deletes the specified subscription from the specified organization.

DeleteUser.description: Deletes the specified user from a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory.

InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.description: Creates a new document object and version object.

RemoveAllResourcePermissions.description: Removes all the permissions from the specified resource.

RemoveResourcePermission.description: Removes the permission for the specified principal from the specified resource.

UpdateDocument.description: Updates the specified attributes of the specified document.

UpdateDocumentVersion.description: Changes the status of the document version to ACTIVE.

UpdateFolder.description: Updates the specified attributes of the specified folder.

UpdateUser.description: Updates the specified attributes of the specified user, and grants or revokes administrative privileges to the Amazon WorkDocs site.

workmail.description: Secure and Managed Business Email and Calendaring

AddMembersToGroup.description: Adds a list of members (users or groups) to a group.

CreateGroup.description: Creates a new group in the directory (but doesn\'t enable it for mail).

CreateMailUser.description: Creates a user in the directory and the WorkMail storage but does not enable the user for mail.

CreateOrganization.description: Creates an organization, either using an existing directory or creates a new directory on-the-fly. Also creates and enables the complementary mail domain. Optionally creates KMS key

DescribeWorkspaceBundles.description: Obtains information about the WorkSpace bundles that are available to your account in the specified region.

DescribeWorkspaceDirectories.description: Retrieves information about the AWS Directory Service directories in the region that are registered with Amazon WorkSpaces and are available to your account.

DescribeWorkspaces.description: Obtains information about the specified WorkSpaces.

DescribeWorkspacesConnectionStatus.description: Describes the connection status of a specified WorkSpace.

ModifyWorkspaceProperties.description: Modifies the WorkSpace properties, including the running mode and AutoStop time.

GetEncryptionConfig.description: Retrieves the current encryption configuration for X-Ray data.

PutEncryptionConfig.description: Updates the encryption configuration for X-Ray data.

BatchGetTraces.description: Retrieves a list of traces specified by ID. Each trace is a collection of segment documents that originates from a single request. Use GetTraceSummaries to get a list of trace IDs.

GetSamplingStatisticSummaries.description: Retrieves information about recent sampling results for all sampling rules.

GetSamplingTargets.description: Requests a sampling quota for rules that the service is using to sample requests.

GetServiceGraph.description: Retrieves a document that describes services that process incoming requests, and downstream services that they call as a result.

GetTraceGraph.description: Retrieves a service graph for one or more specific trace IDs.

GetTraceSummaries.description: Retrieves IDs and metadata for traces available for a specified time frame using an optional filter. To get the full traces, pass the trace IDs to BatchGetTraces.

CreateGroup.description: Creates a group resource with a name and a filter expression.

CreateSamplingRule.description: Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications.

PutTelemetryRecords.description: Used by the AWS X-Ray daemon to send telemetry to the service.

PutTraceSegments.description: Uploads segment documents to AWS X-Ray. The X-Ray SDK generates segment documents and sends them to the X-Ray daemon, which uploads them in batches.
